job_tasks.phrase: helping them bridge the gap between IT Support and DevOps.
job_tasks.justification: The phrase indicates a focus on operational processes and bridging IT support with DevOps principles, aligning with the operational aspect of 1.A.2, though the context is IT support rather than ML/GenAI.

job_tasks.phrase: Technical challenges, major changes and related projects will be part of your daily business.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase implies involvement in projects and system changes, which can encompass integration and development tasks within an IT operations context.

job_tasks.phrase: You will be a DevOps Engineer with a focus on our employees and their IT service needs.
job_tasks.justification: The role is described as a "DevOps Engineer" focused on IT service needs, indicating a strong emphasis on operational processes and system management.

job_tasks.phrase: working closely together with the DevOps Engineers to solve more complex support issues reported by other Engineers and Developers at DeepL
job_tasks.justification: Working with DevOps engineers to solve complex support issues implies a role in maintaining and integrating IT systems and services.

job_tasks.phrase: improve and automate the processes for the IT support team
job_tasks.justification: Improving and automating processes directly relates to operational efficiency and streamlining workflows, aligning with the spirit of DevOps and operational management.

job_tasks.phrase: Maintain and administer various tools served by the IT Support team
job_tasks.justification: Maintaining and administering tools is a core operational responsibility for ensuring the availability and functionality of IT services.

soft_skills.phrase: You will assist the more junior members of the team with classical IT support issues
soft_skills.justification: Assisting junior members involves mentoring and knowledge transfer within the team.

soft_skills.phrase: Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities.
soft_skills.justification: Working in a diverse, international team requires strong collaboration and communication skills.

soft_skills.phrase: Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.
soft_skills.justification: Directly states the importance of clear communication, collaboration, and feedback.
Mentions fostering effective and seamless collaboration despite remote and flexible work arrangements.

soft_skills.phrase: Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team
soft_skills.justification: Refers to team events designed to foster bonding and collaboration.

soft_skills.phrase: Monthly full-day hacking sessions: ... get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.
soft_skills.justification: Encourages initiative, impact, and creativity, which aligns with innovation and ownership.

soft_skills.phrase: Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.
soft_skills.justification: Explicitly mentions continuous learning and professional development support.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement describes an IT Operations Engineer role focused on IT support, process automation, and bridging IT support with DevOps principles. There is no mention of Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Generative AI, LLMs, or any related technologies or tasks as defined within the CODING_BOOK.md. Therefore, the role does not align with any of the AI/ML-focused profiles.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear about its focus on IT Operations and Support. The absence of any AI/ML related keywords or concepts makes the classification as 'Not Relevant' unambiguous, given the constraints of the CODING_BOOK.md. The ad is well-written and easy to understand.
